content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 8 to node 12 is:

8 -> 8 -> 10 -> 12

Note that this is the shortest path that includes node 12 as the final destination. If you want to find the shortest path that starts and ends at different nodes, you would need to swap the start and end nodes in the question.

The shortest path from node 12 to node 8 is:

12 -> 12 -> 10 -> 8

Note that this is the shortest path that includes node 8 as the final destination. If you want to find the shortest path that starts and ends at different nodes, you would need to swap the start and end nodes in the question.
